TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TableRowGroup extends System.Windows.Documents.TextElement implements class System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Docs.summary: Represents a flow content element used to group elements within a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class provides a way to arbitrarily group rows within a table; every row in a table must belong to a row grouping. Rows within a row group often share a common intent, and can be styled as a group. A common use for row groupings is to separate special-purpose rows, such as a title, header, and footer rows, from the primary content contained by the table.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowCollection> returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup> element (i.e. add/remove rows).
## Examples The following examples show how to use this property to perform common operations on a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup>.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup.Rows%2A> property should be persisted.
Docs.returns: if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup.Rows%2A> property does not have a simple default value. This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableRowGroup>.
